Sec. 21-14.1. Transmission of hoax substances.
It shall be a violation of this section for any person to knowingly and intentionally transmit, send, deliver, or display, or to threaten or conspire to transmit, send, deliver, or display, to another person or organization, whether public or private, any hoax substance which a reasonable person would believe is a chemical or biological agent intended to cause the illness or death of any person. Any person convicted of a violation of this section shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00), or by imprisonment not to exceed sixty (60) days, or both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court.
